text:
Went for lunch on a Tuesday at around 12:45pm. As usual, there was a line, but it moved really quickly and I was able to get my pizza 10 minutes later. Don’t let the line deter you from trying Joe’s! The pizza is great as always and the staff are nice. Never disappointed. I tried the caprese pizza and it was great!

There are a lot of people inside and outside so it can get hectic, but turnover for seats is quite quick and I got a seat on the bench outside almost right away.

Their pizza made my birthday, and my four year wish to try this place fulfilled. My friends and I shared a pie to get that traditional New York slice. It came out very fast and was tasted excellent. It's an amazing atmosphere in the store and so cool to see so many celebrities on the wall. I can't wait to come back!

I have heard so many things and references to do with Joe's Pizza over the years I had to try it for myself, be prepared to wait in line! I waited for over 1 hour and a half, was it worth it? Yes, definitely. It's definitely authentic Italian. You can buy a slice or a large pizza. There is a small selection of soft drinks, and the imported drinks were $4. Each it's a very popular place, they also offer delivery. It's a small restaurant, but it has an amazing atmosphere. Just watching the people making the pizzas and how they work in such a busy environment and how they work together under so much pressure was excellent.

I initially thought Joe’s Pizza might be overrated, but I was pleasantly surprised. The pizza was fantastic, and their quick service and friendly banter made the wait in line totally worth it. The store itself is a unique experience, adorned with photos of them with the famous personalities and currencies from around the world. It’s more than just a meal it’s an experience. Highly recommended!

4.3 is the current Google rating at the time of this review.

Popular place for sure, the line went out the door and down the street. An estimated wait time for this visit was around 30-40 until we got our pizza, and that’s from the moment we got in line.

Seating inside and standing outside available here, but you need to stay keen on the getting stools from those about to leave. There’s not enough stools inside and dining in is rather small.

Outside there’s a covered stand where inside it has wall countertops. This area is also small but I like how Joe’s thought to add this because it does help.

The staff are dedicated and definitely busy making pizza pies for everyone. I observed staff going around and cleaning areas and replacing the plastic bowls they keep out for patrons to use: Parmesan cheese and spices.

The pizza itself comes out hot so be prepared for that. We had a pepperoni cheese pizza and it was good. You just need to be patient and while you wait snag up those stools!

I’d definitely come back 💯

Definitely a must experience! We came since we have watched the Spiderman movie and noticed this place was in one of the movies. Super small restaurant with minimal space to dine but we managed. The atmosphere is worth visiting.  The pictures on the wall let you know how popular this place is. All types of celebrities have been. The pizza is a nice NY style slice with a thin crust and generous amount of cheese.

Truly is the best slice of NYC pizza I’ve ever had. It is incredible and worth the wait. If you show up later in the night, the wait will be less, but don’t be surprised to stand in line around the corner to try this spot. When I’m in town again, this is will be my first stop.

October 2024
I’d give it just about 4 stars because it was very good, classic, crispy, thin-crust, NY-style pizza, but I was not blown away.  Living in the Philadelphia area, I guess I’m conditioned with all the wonderful authentic Italian places.  It’s very cramped inside and the line didn’t move as fast as expected.  I was about 50 in line and I waited maybe 45 minutes.  So it was good but I wouldn’t wait this long again for it.

Came here for a tour and honestly, it was average. Don’t expect too much and you should be fine. I’m pretty sure if you’re a Googler then you’ll get to see more.

It was nice to be there, and we were taken to two cafes, see the plants that employees plant and a Google bike that went away as an employee used it then it was the end. It’s much better to walk around yourself, visit the Google Store and hang out at the cafe next door.

I had high expectations therefore gave it 3 stars.

Walked around after a tour of the Vistor Experience. Not really much to see, but I was fascinated with the landscaping and plants. Not too many tech parks have watermelons growing. Lots of pollinators were being visited by their flying friend. Impressive that a company of this size cares enough to do such a good job!

If you're not an employee, you can't see any of the

interesting stuff. So it's just a bunch of office buildings in a boring corner

of a not very interesting town.

If you're interested in the Computer History Museum nearby, by all means do a drive-by while you're in the area.

But don't go there just to see the GooglePlex, it really isn't

worth the time it would take to get there.

google hosts activities occasionally which is such a great way to being about people together. otherwise it's such an inspiring place to just work in, the cafe has very reasonable prices, the environment is great

So disapointed! Everywhere in the internet is marked that there is a Google Store (similar to Apple) but no, here is absolutely nothing for public - even the water in the public toilet did not work. My family just told me to sell my android phone ... sad all the way from Switzerland, just to see the (pretty nice) Googleplex from the outside

Get your Google on and make a pilgrimage you geeks!
The butternut squash soup is fantastic! 😋👍
You will enjoy a wonderful experience! …
Cute little pop up shop inside, tasty sandwiches, and the Google Store has all the latest Google gadgets. Bathrooms encourage everyone to be Googley.

Google is the best. Plain and Simple, I need to work on my resume to work here someday!

Google Inc, if you see this, let me be an ambassador for you 😂😂

Currently a Level 5 Local Guide, so working on becoming the best.

It’s a beautiful campus though!

The 1 thing I need added here though is a Gift Shop… I’d buy so much Google Apparel, would be super cool!

Visiting the Apple Park Visitor Center is an incredible experience for any Apple enthusiast or design lover! From the moment you arrive, you can sense the attention to detail that Apple is famous for. The architecture of the building is sleek, modern, and beautifully integrated into the surrounding landscape, reflecting the innovative spirit of the company.

The open-air terrace offers stunning views of the iconic Apple Park campus, and the augmented reality experience allows you to explore the building in a unique, interactive way. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, always ready to share interesting facts about the campus and the history of Apple.

The store inside offers exclusive Apple merchandise you won’t find anywhere else, making it a perfect place to pick up a souvenir. The on-site café serves delicious, freshly brewed coffee and a selection of treats, all while you relax in the peaceful atmosphere.

Overall, the Apple Park Visitor Center is a must-visit, whether you’re a tech fan or just appreciate thoughtful design. It’s more than just a visitor center — it’s a reflection of Apple’s vision and commitment to creating beautiful, functional spaces. Highly recommended!

Visit to this center is a memorable experience.Apple Park is 160+ acre headquarters of Apple. A store and cafeteria for public. Most of the space is off limits to the public but you can see an augmented reality layout in the same building as the Apple Store

We ran out of things to do on our last day of our San Francisco trip and we ended going here and loved the experience and a good outing for a couple of hours.

On the ground floor you will find a mind blowing miniature architecture of the Apple space ship/park that can we viewed in a super realistic way using an iPad that will provided for free at the visitor center.

Additionally there is the regular Apple Store in the center of the floor and and the end of the floor is a nice cafe serving delicious beverages with cute Apple logos as your foam design on your coffee.

On the top floor they have a beautiful seating area to take pictures for your gram.

Parking is available for free outside the center but limited.

Slightly underwhelming. If you’re expecting to get a clean look at Apple Park, beware: this is nothing more than a jumbo version of the Apple Store across the street from the campus.

There’s a cool AR feature that lets you do a virtual tour of the campus and a cafe. The bathrooms are clean. There’s a rooftop where you can see some of the campus though.

The staff is awesome—knowledgeable and very helpful. Apple is great, as always. However, it would be nice to see more unique items, like they used to offer. (Maybe I would have bought a new Mac or something, but I already have pretty much everything—lol.) It’s a beautiful campus. That’s Apple for you.

The vibe and experience and customer service was great! The glass interiors, upstairs outlook, and cafe was nice. Really wanted to see the campus which you get to see and feel at Google with their bike ride.
Very cool place to visit. Love the high technologies where you can see the whole of the Apple Park. All the devices are on display and the cafe is really nice.
It was an excellent experience visiting Apple Park visitor center. There were so many helpful assistances, and also lessons going on. A great place to visit and explore more about. 👏! …
